intro: Homalium microphyllum var. delphinense, commonly known as the small-leaved holly. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is sometimes used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of this variant include its distinctive leaf morphology and floral structure, which contribute to its ecological role in its native habitat.
